    • Constructor Detail

      • FIXConnection

        public FIXConnection(Clock clock,
                     SocketChannel channel,
                     FIXConfig config,
                     FIXMessageListener listener,
                     FIXConnectionStatusListener statusListener)
        Create a connection. The underlying socket channel can be either blocking or non-blocking.
        Parameters:
        clock - the clock
        channel - the underlying socket channel
        config - the connection configuration
        listener - the inbound message listener
        statusListener - the inbound status event listener

      • FIXConnection

        Parameters:

      • prepare

        public void prepare(FIXMessage message,
                    char msgType)

        Prepare a message. When preparing a message, the following mandatory fields are added:

        • MsgType(35)
        • SenderCompID(49)
        • TargetCompID(56)
        • MsgSeqNum(34)
        • SendingTime(52)
        Parameters:
        message - a message
        msgType - the MsgType(35)

      • prepare

        public void prepare(FIXMessage message,
                    CharSequence msgType)

        Prepare a message.

        Parameters:
        message - a message
        msgType - the MsgType(35)
        See Also:
        prepare(FIXMessage, char)

      • update

        public void update(FIXMessage message)

        Update a message. When updating a message, the following mandatory fields are updated:

        • MsgSeqNum(34)
        • SendingTime(52)
        Parameters:
        message - a message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if MsgSeqNum(34) or SendingTime(52) is not found

      • updateCompID

        public void updateCompID(FIXMessage message)
        Update SenderCompID(49) and TargetCompID(56).
        Parameters:
        message - a message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if SenderCompID(49) or TargetCompID(56) is not found

      • updateCurrentTimestamp

        public void updateCurrentTimestamp()

        Update the current timestamp. The current timestamp is used for the following purposes:

        • SendingTime(52)
        • the connection keep-alive mechanism

      • getCurrentTimestamp

        public CharSequence getCurrentTimestamp()
        Get the current timestamp.
        Returns:
        the current timestamp

      • keepAlive

        public void keepAlive()
               throws IOException
        Keep this connection alive.

        If the duration indicated by HeartBtInt(108) has passed since sending a message, send a Heartbeat(0) message.

        If the duration indicated by HeartBtInt(108) amended with a reasonable transmission time has passed since receiving a message, send a TestRequest(1) message.

        If a TestRequest(1) message has been sent and no data has been received within the duration indicated by HeartBtInt(108) amended with a reasonable transmission time, trigger a status event indicating heartbeat timeout.

        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Close the underlying socket channel.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • receive

        public int receive()
            throws IOException
        Receive data from the underlying socket channel. For each message received, invoke the message listener if applicable.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes read, possibly zero, or -1 if the channel has reached end-of-stream
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • sendLogon

        public void sendLogon(boolean resetSeqNum)
               throws IOException
        Send a Logon(A) message. Set EncryptMethod(98) to 0 and HeartBtInt(108) according to the connection configuration.
        Parameters:
        resetSeqNum - if true set ResetSeqNumFlag(141) to true, otherwise omit ResetSeqNumFlag(141)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
